website_summaries.verdict: A smooth-running, high-capacity electric jack that really shines in low-light settings.
pros: Has 4 LED lights for low-light operation
Comes with mounting hardware and a manual crank
cons: Operation is a bit on the slow side
Some reports of this option failing within a few months

website_summaries.verdict: A unique option for stabilizing a trailer RV that requires less preparation and setup.
pros: Lessens the amount of time required to prepare the RV for stabilization
Compatible with many different trailer and camper types
cons: Limited 3,500-pound capacity won't work for heavier RVs

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to put on our camper
customer_reviews.text: Was way quieter then I expected it to be. Super easy to put on our camper. Very pleased so far with the purchase. We can even open up our tail gate on our Ford F-250 Super Duty. Would recommend this product to friends and family. The video sounds loud but when you are right there it isn't that loud.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry/Ron

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny to upgrade from a manual jack to this
customer_reviews.text: This was a welcome addition to our recently purchased Jayco camper. Installation is easy enough, 3 bolts and one wire to the battery. These are definitely quieter and smoother than previous generations of Lippert power tongue jacks. I also think maybe they are a bit slower in operation too, which is perfectly ok, as they still allow you to raise and lower the tongue quite quickly...just something I happened to notice about them. If you have a trailer with a manual jack, this is an upgrade I would absolutely recommend. Installation is easy...if you can use a socket wrench, you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trailer jack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome trailer jack! The mounting holes were different than the manual crank one I had previously, so had to drill 2 new holes (the 2 rear ones as the front one I could work with) and tap threads into the holes. I also ran nuts underneath to ensure it was strong. I saw some complain about it being slow, but it doesn't seem slow compared to when I had to manually crank the damn thing! LOL!
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last two months and I can't return it.
customer_reviews.text: This unit did not last me two months before it completely failed and now I am out $183.00 because it went past the one month Amazon return policy. Do not by this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: oldasdirt

customer_reviews.title: Test before mounting.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this jack for my utility trailer. After mounting it on it did not work, only a clicking noise. Tried the manual crack and it would not give until I put a tork wrench on it and then the nut broke. Jack did work after that but I called manufacturer to order a new nut and he said whole jack would need replaced because they do not sell nut separately. Returning jack and getting a different brand. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Garton

customer_reviews.title: Disenchanted Senior Citizen !!
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, well put together, but agonizingly slow !! Also, no drop leg to facilitate height options. I called Lippert to see if there might be an accessory. "NO" was my answer, "We do not have any such thing". Funny thing, Page 22 of my July 2017 Trailer Life Magazine shows a Lippert Smart Jack that has the drop leg feature as well as other improvements. I paid Amazon a sizeable amount of money for my jack, and I now find myself dissatisfied and discouraged. Candidly, I now wonder if I was sold something by Amazon that was discontinued/outdated, etc.???? I am NOT a Happy Camper !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Grant Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: No more cranking up and down!
customer_reviews.text: I shopped for several jacks and found this one to be the most aesthetically appealing in comparison to others. The light feature is nice for using in the dark. It does move slowly as other reviewers stated, but has no difficulty raising heavy tongue weight. I just used the jack on a 4700 mile trip where I had to hook and unhook my travel trailer numerous times at campgrounds. It worked flawlessly and was worth every penny spent.
customer_reviews.author: T Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Great Power Tongue Jack - Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase as this was listed as "Used-Like New" but the price was right. It showed up repackaged with no factory packaging which I expected. The seller did a good job repackaging for shipping. Upon opening the box I was pleased to see no damage and all parts were included. Easy install on to my camper and it works perfectly. Quiet and smooth operation, lifts my 21 ft Coachman Catalina with ease. Happy Camper here.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S McConkey

customer_reviews.title: Half works anyhow
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival, led light Bank in front isnt working. Can't see my way to now go thru and remove it back from my camper, install my old on back on, manually crank it bak up and box up jack,take to ups drop off and (hopefully) get one that lights do work. If I wanted a jack without a light, I would've ordered one. Let's are $57 from lippert so maybe they know of issue? But I'll give u 3 stars just for the working of jack..Thats it tho..Unless u would like to send me an LED replacement and I'd b glad to send this one bak to u, with a prepaid label of course.
customer_reviews.author: Lad

customer_reviews.title: Switches not water proof
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. After a heavy rain last night this morning light is on but switch is off. Cycled on off and lamp turned off. This afternoon. Light is on. Toggle switch is off. Cycled on off. Same thing. Water coming out. Switch is not weather proof and water is shorting out the on side. Lippert. I bought the steps. Great. Fix this please ir productbwill be returned. God forbid the extend retract button stick while the trailer stabilizer Jack's asr down. It will ruin the frame of the trailer
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack with Two Design Flaws
customer_reviews.text: The jack does the job of lifting. There are two design flaws, however, that leave me wishing I had purchased something different. First, the head is large, and interferes with opening the tailgate on my truck. The jack cannot be rotated 90o to alleviate this interference, due to the mounting bolts. The head cannot be rotated 90o on the jack. Second. the jack has no limit switches. You must watch carefully when retracting or it will make a horrible noise as if gears are grinding when it comes to the upper limit of travel.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Donnaway

customer_reviews.title: Nice, easy installation!
customer_reviews.text: One-wire hookup straight to +12VDC at the battery, unit grounds through the frame for negative side, makes this installation a sub-5 minute job! It is really slow to go up and down, but that ensures me it will last quite a long time as there's no sound of it struggling to lift the trailer. I doubt I'll be in that much of a rush to require instantaneous lift or lowering of this jack!!! The light is decent with plenty enough light to hitch/unhitch in absolute darkness, and the fact that its an led means I probably won't need to replace it in the time I own this trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Flyin'Hawaiian

customer_reviews.title: POWER!!
customer_reviews.text: Lippert is a huge name in the RV industry. This is so much better than hand cranking. I bought this for my son-in-law and he was thrilled with it the very first time he used it. What a huge time-saver, back-saver, and frustration reliever! Especially when camping in high elevations where catching one's breath is a huffing-puffing ordeal. I recommend using this while the trailer power is still hooked to a running tow vehicle or shore power to save on draining the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Harrington, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Powered jack is a great convenience!
customer_reviews.text: I saw one of these on another camp trailer when I had ours in for service. It looked very convenient so I checked on Amazon and they had it at a discounted very reasonable price. It was extremely easy to install, but I thought it was DOA when it didn't work. The LED convenience lights worked but the jack didn't move. Turns out my trailer battery was low and needed recharging. After a couple of hours on the charger everything worked great. This jack is so convenient it should be required equipment on all trailers. I'm going to add one to my other trailer as well. This one is highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mike the Poppa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit, easy install, very happy
customer_reviews.text: I only wish this came with a drop-leg extension, but I purchased that separately. I also have the Lippert 'Lets go Aero' bike rack and that sits directly above the manual crank hole. This jack comes with a manual crank arm that is a regular 3/4 socket that you can also use on your stabilizers.. pretty sure this is the normal use for it! It is this type of attention to detail that I greatly appreciate, not to mention the peace of mind in the event of another failure.
customer_reviews.author: B. Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The jack arrived quickly and in good shape. It was very easy to install. Speed seemed reasonable and wasn't too loud. I checked it out and everything worked fine. Lifted the rear of the truck to attach equalizer bars with no change in motor noise. Shortly after that we took the camper to Fl. When we arrived the light sw. didn't work, just felt like there wasn't anything in there. Thankfully it was only the light sw. The jack worked flawlessly on "many" setups and takedowns. Just got home and haven't tried taking it apart yet to see if I can fix it.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Item was defective and will not work
customer_reviews.text: This item was installed by a professional RV facility. When it was taken from the package a blown fuse was noticed still in the fuse container in the electrical connection line. A new fuse was inserted. Installation was completed and, while the light would come on, the motor in the unit would not work. It was inoperable and defective. Item is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Bought new, got used.  Buyers beware!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Paid $201 for this item and it showed up in a box that looked like it was dragged behind a truck. Not only that, but it was missing the manual crank handle. I have a feeling it’s probably broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: as it sounds like the gears just about snap off
customer_reviews.text: Such a big improvement over the manual jack. Be very careful not to over retract or extend the foot, as it sounds like the gears just about snap off. It really should have an indicator on the foot of when to stop, but doesn't. Lifts my travel trailer with around 750 pounds of tounge weight just fine. Received 4 stars because it is quite slow. I'd recommend to the manufacture of having a high speed gear in addition to the lifting gear.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: I would not order this product again
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived with the box completely torn up. It was missing the footplate the pin for the front plate and the bolts. I will not be ordering this product again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: easy install
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that as remotely negative about this jack is how slow it is, I wish it were a bit faster but it was an easy installation and does what it is supposed to do. Our other jack, (exact same one that came with our camper) lasted 5 years so not a bad investment.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Garfunkal

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and light doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Box was destroyed during shipping, foot pad and quick release missing, I installed this as I needed something to replace oem jack. Install is very easy. The jack performs but the light doesn't work. Can you send me a light??? Thanks for send the foot pad....
customer_reviews.author: t.j. boyle

customer_reviews.title: Power switch failed in months - can't cut power to unit. Unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and worked great.. for a while. After only a couple of months I realized that the power switch no longer works. I cannot turn it off. Even with the power switch in the off position the jack will extend and retract. HUGE safety issue. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old town Hatch psychosis one. I recently traveled across country so I used it quite a bit in the short time that I’ve on it and it works great. My one complaint is that it does Not extend or retract as far as my old one dead. In other words it’s shorter. And apparently I found out that most of them are this size and the tongue jack that I had previously just happen to be longer by at least a foot. Other than that I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had to replace immediately
customer_reviews.text: Not durable. Had to replace after installation due to faulty wiring
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lattimore

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably EASY Installation !!!
customer_reviews.text: Super surprised at how easy this item was to install ! Works super quiet and get the job done. Our travel trailer is a 28 ft Coachman Catalina and this Jack has NO problem raising and lowering it. Only downfall is it seems a bit slow , but researching other brands it appears they all seem to have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: aaronr1204

customer_reviews.title: So simple a cave man could do it 😜
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered, on time in an orderly box and took 15 minutes to install, including removal of my old defunct Bulldog jack. You’ll need a battery cable connection for the pre stripped power wire but it’s a since to install. 3 bolts, and make the 1 wire connection, and you’re done. It’s that simple. Quiet / smooth operation. Looks good too I might add. Thanks Lippert.
customer_reviews.author: On the water

customer_reviews.title: does not work
customer_reviews.text: First one I ordered was very slow and the light didn't work, I ordered a 2nd one and the jack came but was obviously used! It did not come with any of the bolts or pins, when it was hooked up it didn't work at all!! Made in USA must not mean much anymore!
customer_reviews.author: colleen everhart

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, fit perfectly on my 2010 Keystone HideOut
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, fit perfectly on my 2010 Keystone HideOut. Much quieter than previous Attwood unit. Gear ratio is slower which is a good thing: does not sound like it is laboring nearly as much when removing truck weight for sway bar installation. I would give this 5 stars and highly recommend with one exception: After reading customer reviews, I selected this unit compared to many others based on user feed back that I could open my tailgate. I have a 2016 F350 and the tail gate overlap is probably an inch. Ugh! So close, but no dice. Other than customer feedback, not sure how you determine tailgate clearance...or lack of. If tailgate clearance is not an issue, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Kessinger

customer_reviews.title: The New Jack was very easy to install and appears to be working fine.
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to get ahold of the company as my Jack Package did not include the Footpad. I didn't want to send everything back just for the footpad. Everything else including pin for footpad was in the packaging. I have installed the jack as it was very easily done and appears to be working fine. I just can't tell how much power it has yet until I have the footpad to install. Would have given 5 stars if the package was complete.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shively

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Easy to Install - Very Slow Extension Speed
customer_reviews.text: This power tongue jack seems to be very good quality and is VERY easy to install. It took me about 15 minutes to get it installed on my 30 foot camper. My only complaint with this is that it is VERY slow. I could probably crank a hand jack much faster than this. That's why I'm rating it at 4 stars instead of 5. Other than the ridiculously slow speed, the quality of the materials and ease of installation is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Jack works, light does not.
customer_reviews.text: Quality assurance on jack was horrible. Installed jack easily, works great. Turned LED light on...no go. Played with switch checked wiring, it is just faulty. Should have been caught by quality control. I'm going to leave it on, as it isn't worth the labor to take off, and ship. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: zoom zoom

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and easy to replace with little effort. Word of caution if you are removing and old jack be sure to block the trailer in place. My old hand crank jack stopped working so I order this as an upgrade. During the removal of the old jack the trailer actually fell lucky for me I had postitioned the truck under the ball hitch and the trailer only fell 3-4 inches and I was clear when it fell. The new jack bolted right up to the old holes and no issues on the hook up. Plenty of power as well. Only draw back is that you need to purchase the bag to cover the controls as they aren’t waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: nae

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and very easy installation. I’m suprised
customer_reviews.text: What a surprise. Installations was actually as easy as described for once. 3 bolts out for the manual jack, 3 bolts in for the new jack and connected the 1 and only wire to the positive side of the battery on our camper... done in about 15 minutes! Works much easier than our old crank Jack when using the manual option as well. Very pleased and Now I hope it holds up in the long run!
customer_reviews.author: sam smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Just got it installed, took me about 20 min I ran out to ACE Hardware to get a battery ring connector tested the unit noise level is acceptable speed is okay is faster then hand cranking light works did not need to do any extra connection only 1 Red wire to my battery positive terminal. Also I purchased this cover on last 2 pictures to protect it from rain and UV damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: EXT/RET Switch failed approx. 6 months after purchase
customer_reviews.text: This jack worked great on our Micro-Mini. We'd only used it a couple of times before the Covid19 hit and most of the parks nearby closed, so it didn't get a lot of use. Well, we went to leave recently and the jack would not retract. Had to switch back to the old manual jack. When we got home I disassembled and found the contacts on the retract side of the switch had apparently arched/corroded and were not making contact. I cleaned them up, and reassembled everything, but haven't reinstalled yet on our trailer (it's working fine now) as I'm hesitant to use this jack that failed so quickly after relatively few cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy install-short life span
customer_reviews.text: Took longer to hook my truck to the camper than the install did ,super easy and well worth the money ,dont know why I waited so long to get one...update...3.5 months in and the retract stopped working. We have only used it 4 times to go camping. Have to manually crank it back down. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: jason l gordon

customer_reviews.title: Six stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down one of my best purchases EVER. I don't often rave about stuff but this jack delivers. In order to put our rv on the truck it must be raised and lowered twice every time. I hand cranked it one time and order this life saver.
customer_reviews.author: 20kcounting

customer_reviews.title: This replacement jack was easy to put on and wire up
customer_reviews.text: We damaged our Lippert jack on our new 2017 Rockwood RV. This replacement jack was easy to put on and wire up. Our existing jack was bent and had to be cut off where it was damaged, but the new one works great.
customer_reviews.author: Judy.Go in Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for a better product. It does what it was intended for and does it well. A basic device that does 2 things, changes the vertical heigth of a trailer hitch and shines a light towards your hitch. What's great about this jack is that the simplicity shouldn't cause there to be any questions. If you can't put your tailgate down while attached to trailer, unattach from your trailer. If you want a wheel on the bottom, pull the pin out and put a wheel. I don't understand why there are any bad reviews on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not happy! Returning for refund and buying an "Atwood" which ...
customer_reviews.text: Lippert 285318 3500LB Power Tongue Jack Black .Missing parts, appeared to have been repackaged and sold a second time to me from someone who also returned it.. Original box inside the BIG Amazon box was damaged with evidence of the product bouncing all over and through the cardboard. Not happy! Returning for refund and buying an "Atwood" which is made in the USA.. My advice is to read ALL the reviews and not buy the cheaper product.. Lesson learned... My day was wasted.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy breezy
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. I drilled/tapped it so I am able to lower the tailgate. Only weird thing is there is no ground wire. I’m assuming the bolts that bolt the jack to the frame bite into the frame and acts as a ground. It works, but I probably should have scraped the paint on the frame a little.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 27’ camper
customer_reviews.text: When the electric tongue jack on our camper died while packing up to leave for a camping weekend we immediately went online to find a replacement. Thankfully we found this one (same brand as our original) on Amazon and decided to test our luck on a returned product rather than a new one that was $50+ more. The product arrived in the original packaging, which looked like it had never been opened and wasn’t missing a thing. Installation was extremely quick and easy . We’ve been using it for a few weeks now and it works great. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Abby C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation and Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: This jack was a great replacement for the manual one that had limited range on our trailer. The manual one required multiple blocks and lots of finagaling to hitch and unhitch the unit from my truck. This one has the range I need and works like a charm. Very pleased with the install ease and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Radgear

customer_reviews.title: Great electric jack
customer_reviews.text: Replaced Older Lippert with this new one. I have a WDAS hitch and the jack easily lifts the trailer and the back end of the truck to allow me to connect the weight distribution bars.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk T

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to Install, although it isn't the fastest moving, it isn't as slow as some of the Electric Jacks I've seen, but it works smoothly, is Quieter than I thought it would be, I would definately recommend buying it, it's worth the money and was reasonably Priced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: After breaking my original jack from stupidity I was able to get this one and it fit the bill as expected. Appears to be a little on the some what slower but lets face it; it's not suppose to be fast. I am happy with what I got for the money even tho there were some cheaper. Lets face it some times you get what you pay for and I needed something I figured I could depend on and I got it. I do recommend this jack.
customer_reviews.author: Roger D Newman

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, easy install but questioning reliability?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in November 2018. Used half dozen times since install. Has been covered until recent outing, and motor would not engage. Had to use manual handle to crank and lower. Light illuminated, but motor would not engage or power up to raise and lower trailer. Verified power and ground leading in to case. Did not disassemble case to verify connection internal. (shouldn't have to on something this new). Contacted Lippert direct for warranty instructions, they redirected me back to Amazon for warranty. Let's see what happens from here! Got another trip planned in 7 days, so I hope the process doesn't take too long.
customer_reviews.author: Somewhere in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the broken Atwood on my trailer after 10 years.  Works fine; a tad slower.
customer_reviews.text: This jack did a good job of replacing the Atwood on my 28' toy hauler. I am a little disappointed in the speed of the jack. It is definitely "Slower" than my old Atwood, but it gets the job done fine with a little bit of patience.
customer_reviews.author: pc

customer_reviews.title: Big and slow
customer_reviews.text: The top plastic cover is SO BIG I can’t open my tailgate with the trailer on. It’s also VERY slow. And it sticks down too far so I need to get a shorter wood block which will even make it slower.... I would not recommend this jack.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Very easy installation
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a new travel trailer that had a manual hand crank tongue jack. Installation was straight forward and simple. The mounting holes lined up perfectly with the holes on my trailer. The entire installation took about 30 minutes and the jack works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t had this very long but as of now it’s worth every penny. As a few have stated it is slow. I’m not sure how or why it should be faster but it seems that it should be. Only time will tell about the durability.
customer_reviews.author: jim bell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this a five star rating but no cover for powerhead and the instructions are just photos. The power cord is a little short for my trailer which went to the power distribution box. Had to connect directly to battery since it wasn’t long enough to reach box. About twelve inches longer. Works great and like the light.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and awesome
customer_reviews.text: Didnt know much of a difference this would make. Easy to install. Works great and saves time and a whole lot easier for raising and lowering jack. I purchased the Dock and Stow as well perfect combination !!
customer_reviews.author: FL SunShine

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 14 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Nov 2018, it's dead in Feb 2020. Only a 1 year warranty.. Won't buy this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Packaged
customer_reviews.text: Overall the the jack is very good I have the same one installed on another trailer and has worked great. The bad news is it was not packed very well the plastic housing was busted up. I fixed it with super glue and it looks new again. Amazon support gave me a 15% off discount instead of returning it. So 4 stars for the lack of packing material, oh this was already a discounted returned item so it was a scratch and dent anyway but to damage it twice is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Installation is simple but the jack worked fine for the first time. installed cover so water won't get into it. went to South Dakota and back home and won't work. tried to make sure everything was hooked up properly and battery was good but to power. took jack off of trailer and there was water running out of box and like a screw is loose in motor.
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: No more cranking
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install and fit very nicely. As reported the unit is a tad slow but when you are trying to level an absorption refrigerator it makes it easier to set the bubble. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboy98

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, easy to install, but wish it was a little faster
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint with this was its a bit slower than I had expected to raise and lower. The LED light up front is a bit dim too, but otherwise it was very easy to install and works great. So much better than the manual crank I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Nice jack
customer_reviews.text: This jack took very little time to install...it took longer to remove the old jack. It isn't fast but it beats having to hand crank my camping trailer up and down. It is very quiet until you hit the top or bottom of its travel range (18"). A clutch engages at that point. I do recommend buying a cover for the head...$9.99 on Amazon. The light is a nice feature but not very bright.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install but I noticwd that the power wire did not have or come with the connector at the end of the wire. Not a deal breaker. Just put one on. I also noticed that it is extremely quiet and it works well. I am replacing my old one and I noticed that it came with the manual handle in case it stops working and new screws as well. Worth the money and money well spent. I would purchase this item again. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: earby tennyson

customer_reviews.title: Love this jack
customer_reviews.text: Love this jack. Got it as a replacement for the 9 year old identical one that finally gave up the ghost. Due to my trailer tongue design we had to cut the wire and splice it back together. That made the ease of install drop and I really hated having to cut into a brand new wire. Last jack was the same way but you’d think they could remedy this.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Whitfill

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the would buy this again!
customer_reviews.text: It was the most easiest to install!!!!5 minutes tops It works great! Because of the power that comes with it it moves very slowly but that was expected. I would recommend this product and I would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Garagedoorgreg

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Check this upon receiving, ours was broken. We replaced it and this one has been pretty good. Its slow to move the camper up or down, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Mom Of 3

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works well. Had to return first one due to damage suffered by poor packing
customer_reviews.author: Synda F.

customer_reviews.title: Check  shaft holes, may be too small  for direct replacement
customer_reviews.text: Was not a direct replacement for old hand crank jack. Shaft was about a 1/4" wider thsn original mounting hole, had to shave the steel to fit. Bolt pattern was a perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: trailer jack
customer_reviews.text: This jack is an exact replacement of our original one , hope it last longer tho . Found it to be a reasonable price easy to install and praying for a longer life because we did buy a cover to put on it and hopefully it will keep the weather out .
customer_reviews.author: Ford man

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A GIFT FOR MY SON. HE HAS IT ON HIS TRAVEL TRAILER, HAS TAKEN IT ON A TRIP AND REALLY LIKES IT!
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2006 Dodge 1 ton non lifted truck . The jack doesn’t extend far enough to lift the trailer tongue high enough to get it on the ball. I have to carry a good sized block of wood around to place under the jack to get the tongue high enough to hitch the trailer to the truck. The jack also move really slow. But it is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Trail

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact, great looking.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it so durability is yet to be determined. It has raised the trailer just twice as of this date. So we'll have to wait and see. Looks like it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Switch Failed
customer_reviews.text: This unit is just a year old. Been stored covered. Been used about 12 times. Switch to raise/lower the trailer is DEAD. Very disappointing! Too late to return it. Be carefule
customer_reviews.author: Ken Stults

customer_reviews.title: Installation Was A Breeze
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a five year old OEM jack that screamed and clicked every time I used it. Installation was a breeze. Time will tell as to its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostrider61

customer_reviews.title: Product as described. Installation a breeze. Took about ...
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. Installation a breeze. Took about 5 minutes to swap out with the original hack stand. Bolt lined up perfectly. Only thing to add was a terminal to attach to battery. I have not completed the final routing of the power wire to the battery
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rueder

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat it, hook your trailer to your truck, 3 bolts and a battery connection and your rocking with a Electirc jack. It is “slower” but it has torque to lift. Buy it
customer_reviews.author: Mike h

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, was easy to install with 3 bolts and took less than 15 minutes. Saves my back and all the endless cranking. Loaded weight on my Micro Minnie is right around 4000 pounds and this lifted it with no problem at all. I like the light feature for night time safety and unhooking in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Confer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My son replaced my old one with this. Super easy, I might have been able to do it. Works fine. Can’t rate durability at this time.
customer_reviews.author: barbara mintz

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: this replaced our old one and matched up perfectly. very simple to install. Took maybe 10 min. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Lorie Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but very slow
customer_reviews.text: Installation and quality is very good! But the gear ratio is too high, which make raising/lowering very slow compared to my past experiences.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 1st Year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April 0f 2018, Now august 2019 and the jack doesn't work, the motor has a draw on it, guessing the motherboard. Its spent its entire life mostly in a dry heated shed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit standard tongues
customer_reviews.text: This thing does not fit a standard travel trailer tongue---Ridiculous! I had to significantly modify the tongue structure to mount it. A twenty minute job turned into several hours---Ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: eric swensson

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Installed in about 2 minutes. Much more rugged and greater quality than my previous one. A little slower but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great lifter. Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Would like a lockout for rocker switches. Easily bumped when working between tow vehicle and trailer. Great lifting power, good illumination.
customer_reviews.author: LAWRENCE A JUHASZ

customer_reviews.title: 2 years so far on 3 units
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 and all still working well after 2 years. They can pick up the back end of my dually if I need to Chang a tire.
customer_reviews.author: Arron

customer_reviews.title: Quit cranking and buy it
customer_reviews.text: 3 bolts one wire very easy install! Works great does what it's supposed to and way better than cranking!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: Great value, super easy to install. ONE TIP, cover your power head, my old unit was filled with water and made it fail.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: It has it's ups and downs :)
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. Comes with hardware, and wiring with fuse holder. Make sure the battery is charged up on your camper/trailer, or it won't do anything.
customer_reviews.author: dragonmyfeet

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a while now and it works great it is fast and the light works well I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: deborah

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 34’ camper. Works as stated with no power issues. Would like it better if it came with an extendable stand as most campers know most campsites are not too level and I end up using blocks so I don’t have to run all 18” of jack out. Due to the low hearing these jacks use they tend to be slow so it would be nice to have some more adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: JFW5731

customer_reviews.title: A Sturday Replacement.
customer_reviews.text: This jack replaced the OEM jact that came on my trailer. I was pleased that the Lippert jack was of higher quality than the the defective OEM jack.
customer_reviews.author: F. G. Fidura

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have bought this years ago. At 76 years old it's nice just pushing a button to lower or raise the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick from Yuma

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Quick and Handy!! I’m so glad my SIL suggested I get it! Makes unhooking my Camper go smoothly!
customer_reviews.author: Regina A. Eckley

customer_reviews.title: RV
customer_reviews.text: replace my last power tongue jack that shorted out and burned up the motor.. This one is slower but I think it will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry K

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, fit my camper great and looks great. Let's hope it last. I also purchased the cover for it.
customer_reviews.author: William Balch

customer_reviews.title: Check it when it comes in.
customer_reviews.text: 1st one came switch was broken. Ordered another and it works as advertised. Good for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jethro

customer_reviews.title: Rv jack easy to install and hook up
customer_reviews.text: Rv jack easy to install and hook up. When using it, it was very quiet when raising and lowering. The light that is built in is very bright as well. Don't know how I survived without this
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wright

customer_reviews.title: love this item installed with in minutes of delivery and ...
customer_reviews.text: love this item installed with in minutes of delivery and easy to install and is very quiet its gonna be awesome to use no more side winder cranking
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Easier to Install than I Thought
customer_reviews.text: This was simple to in stall and works perfectly. It is is an exact replacement for the original.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Bouchard

customer_reviews.title: Power Trailer Tongue Jack Saves a Lot of Hand Cranking.\
customer_reviews.text: I just used a floor jack to raise the tongue of my trailer and slipped this in on the mount and bolted it in place. The wiring was simple and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Barrak

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install.. We had to replace our 9 year old Lippert power jack that was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Power Tongue Jack
customer_reviews.text: Black easy to install and works well good value makes it easier when hooking up to the camper
customer_reviews.author: Jmh828

product_meta.title: Lippert 285318 3500LB Power Tongue Jack Black
product_meta.description: Lippert 285318 RV Electric Power Tongue Jack 3500 lbs. Capacity Black
feature_bullets: TIME-SAVING. No cranking necessary. Designed with an enhanced rocker switch, you can automatically raise and lower your A-frame trailer with the simple push of a button -- saving you time and energy
EASY INSTALLATION. Complete with all necessary hardware and pins, installation for the Power Tongue Jack is fast and simple, so you can get to lowering and raising your equipment in no time
POWERFULLY DESIGNED. With a 3,500-pound lift capacity and 30 AMPs of power, this jack was constructed to do all the heavy lifting, so you don’t have to
INTEGRATED LIGHTING. Equipped with 4 LED lights that shine directly down on the coupler, you can operate the Power Tongue Jack night or day with ease
ADDED PROTECTION This jack was built with a tough textured casing that protects it from getting chipped or scratched by damaging dirt and debris
ADDED PROTECTION. This jack was built with a tough, textured casing that protects it from getting chipped or scratched by damaging dirt and debris
Lippert Components Power Tongue Jack raises and lowers your trailer with the click of a button
Designed so trailer owners don't have to manually crank their traditional sidewinder jacks
Black color matches most RV models
Increased tube diameter now gives our jack a 3,500-pound rating

specifications.Cover Included: Cotter Pin, Foot Pad, Crank Handle, Clevis Pin, Mounting Bolts
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars934 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
